revised_title: On the Generalization and Systematization of Irrational Functions
tldr: The author presents a method to generalize and systematize the knowledge of irrational functions, showing that all known forms result from other forms of the greatest extent, not depending on particular functions but on the properties of all rational functions. This work expands on previous theories by Newton, Craig, Cotes, Bernoulli, and Waring, and provides a more comprehensive understanding of fluents in irrational functions.
